template.template: PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
template.name: PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
template.description:
This is an unofficial template for PTAF PRO. It requires Zabbix agent 5.0 or newer.
Version template 1.3, contact to Telegram @KH93b https://addons.ptsecurity.com/zabbix-agent-dlya-ptaf-pro

item.name: Host name of Zabbix agent running
Zabbix agent ping
item.description: The agent always returns "1" for this item. May be used in combination with `nodata()` for the availability check.

item.name: Maximum number of open file descriptors
item.description: May be increased by using the `sysctl` utility or modifying the file `/etc/sysctl.conf`.

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/kernel.maxfiles)<{$KERNEL.MAXFILES.MIN}
trigger.name: Linux: Configured max number of open filedescriptors is too low
trigger.event_name: Linux: Configured max number of open filedescriptors is too low (< {$KERNEL.MAXFILES.MIN})

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: May be increased by using the `sysctl` utility or modifying the file `/etc/sysctl.conf`.

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/kernel.maxproc)<{$KERNEL.MAXPROC.MIN}
trigger.name: Linux: Configured max number of processes is too low
trigger.event_name: Linux: Configured max number of processes is too low (< {$KERNEL.MAXPROC.MIN})

dependency.name: Linux: Getting closer to process limit
dependency.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num)/last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/kernel.maxproc)*100>80

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[,,,/opt/correlator/bin/CorrelationService])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service ptaf-correlator Down
trigger.description: Коррелятор недоступен

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[,,,/opt/ptaf/bin/ptaf-core-ctl])>20
trigger.name: PTAF service ptaf-core-rs more 20
trigger.description: Подов обработки трафика больше 20

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[,,,python -m ptaf_report_mgr])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service ptaf-report-mgr is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[beam.smp])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service beam.smp is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[border])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service ptaf-border is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[clickhouse-server,,,/usr/bin/clickhouse-server])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service clickhouse-server is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[containerd])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service containerd is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[etcd])<2
trigger.name: PTAF service etcd is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[grafana])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service Grafana is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[kubelet])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service kubelet is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[minio])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service minio is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[postgres,,,/usr/lib/postgresql/14/bin/postgres])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service postgres is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[ptaf-restproxy])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service ptaf-restproxy is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[vault])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service vault is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num[wsc-daemon])<1
trigger.name: PTAF service wsc-daemon is Down
trigger.description: Важная для работоспособности PTAF PRO служба не запущена

item.name: Interrupts per second
item.description: Number of interrupts processed.

item.name: Load average (1m avg)
item.description: Calculated as the system CPU load divided by the number of CPU cores.

item.name: Load average (5m avg)
item.description: Calculated as the system CPU load divided by the number of CPU cores.

item.name: Load average (15m avg)
item.description: Calculated as the system CPU load divided by the number of CPU cores.

item.name: Context switches per second
item.description: The combined rate at which all processors on the computer are switched from one thread to another.

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: CPU utilization expressed in %.

trigger.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.cpu.util,5m)>{$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}
trigger.name: Linux: High CPU utilization
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

dependency.name: Linux: Load average is too high

item.name: CPU guest time
item.description: Time spent on running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system.

item.name: CPU guest nice time
item.description: Time spent on running a niced guest (a virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel).

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: Time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: Time the CPU has spent servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: Time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: Time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: Time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU steal time
item.description: The amount of "stolen" CPU from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks, such as running another virtual machine.

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: Time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: Time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: System name
item.description: The host name of the system.

trigger.expression: change(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.hostname) and length(last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.hostname))>0
trigger.name: Linux: System name has changed
trigger.event_name: Linux: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: The name of the system has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: System local time
item.description: The local system time of the host.

trigger.expression: fuzzytime(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.localtime,{$SYSTEM.FUZZYTIME.MAX})=0
trigger.recovery_expression: fuzzytime(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.localtime,{$SYSTEM.FUZZYTIME.MIN})=1
trigger.name: Linux: System time is out of sync
trigger.event_name: Linux: System time is out of sync (diff with Zabbix server > {$SYSTEM.FUZZYTIME.MAX})
trigger.description: The host's system time is different from Zabbix server time.

item.name: Operating system architecture
item.description: The architecture of the operating system.

trigger.expression: change(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.sw.os) and length(last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.sw.os))>0
trigger.name: Linux: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: The description of the operating system has changed. Possible reasons are that the system has been updated or replaced. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

dependency.name: Linux: System name has changed
dependency.expression: change(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.hostname) and length(last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.hostname))>0

trigger.expression: change(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.sw.packages)<>0
trigger.name: Linux: Number of installed packages has been changed

item.name: Free swap space
item.description: The free space of the swap volume/file expressed in bytes.

item.name: Free swap space in %
item.description: The free space of the swap volume/file expressed in %.

item.name: Total swap space
item.description: The total space of the swap volume/file expressed in bytes.

item.name: System description
item.description: The information as normally returned by `uname -a`.

item.name: System uptime
item.description: The system uptime expressed in the following format: "N days, hh:mm:ss".

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.uptime)<10m
trigger.name: Linux: {HOST.NAME} has been restarted
trigger.description: The host uptime is less than 10 minutes.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: The number of users who are currently logged in.

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.md5sum[/etc/passwd],#1)<>last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.md5sum[/etc/passwd],#2)
trigger.name: Linux: /etc/passwd has been changed

dependency.name: Linux: Operating system description has changed
dependency.expression: change(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.sw.os) and length(last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.sw.os))>0

dependency.name: Linux: System name has changed
dependency.expression: change(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.hostname) and length(last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.hostname))>0

item.name: Get filesystems
item.description: The `vfs.fs.get` key acquires raw information set about the filesystems. Later to be extracted by preprocessing in dependent items.

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.size[/var/lib,pfree])<25
trigger.name: Low free space on /var/lib (< 25%)

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.size[/var/lib,pfree])<30
trigger.name: Low free space on /var/lib (< 30%)

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.size[/var/lib,pfree])<35
trigger.name: Low free space on /var/lib (< 35%)

item.name: Available memory
item.description:
The available memory: - in Linux = free + buffers + cache; - on other platforms calculation may vary.
See also Appendixes in Zabbix Documentation about parameters of the `vm.memory.size` item.

item.name: Available memory in %
item.description: The available memory as percentage of the total. See also Appendixes in Zabbix Documentation about parameters of the `vm.memory.size` item.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: Total memory expressed in bytes.

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: The percentage of used memory is calculated as `100-pavailable`.

trigger.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vm.memory.utilization,5m)>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}
trigger.name: Linux: High memory utilization
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

dependency.name: Linux: Lack of available memory
dependency.expression: max(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vm.memory.size[available],5m)<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vm.memory.size[total])>0

item.name: Zabbix agent availability
item.description: Used for monitoring the availability status of the agent.

trigger.expression: max(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/zabbix[host,agent,available],{$AGENT.TIMEOUT})=0
trigger.name: Linux: Zabbix agent is not available
trigger.event_name: Linux: Zabbix agent is not available (for {$AGENT.TIMEOUT})
trigger.description: For passive agents only, host availability is used with `{$AGENT.TIMEOUT}` as a time threshold.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])=2 and (last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"],#1)<>last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"],#2))
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the operations status is down. 2. `{$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. `last(/TEMPLATE_NAME/METRIC,#1)<>last(/TEMPLATE_NAME/METRIC,#2)` - the trigger fires only if the operational status was up to (1) sometime before (so, does not fire for "eternal off" interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - it will not fire again on the next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Speed
item_prototype.description:
It indicates the latest or current speed value of the interface. The value is an integer representing the link speed expressed in bits/sec. This attribute is only valid for the interfaces that implement the ethtool `get_link_ksettings` method (mostly Ethernet).
Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Interface type
item_prototype.description: It indicates the interface protocol type as a decimal value. See `include/uapi/linux/if_arp.h` for all possible values. Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"])<0 and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"])>0 and (last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"])=6 or last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"])=1) and (last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"])>0 and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"],#2)>0) or (last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: Interface {#IFNAME}: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

dependency.name: Linux: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])=2 and (last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"],#1)<>last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/net.if.in["{#IFNAME}"],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"]) or avg(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/net.if.out["{#IFNAME}"],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"])) and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/net.if.in["{#IFNAME}"],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"]) and avg(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/net.if.out["{#IFNAME}"],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"])
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: Interface {#IFNAME}: High bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.description: The utilization of the network interface is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Linux: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])=2 and (last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"],#1)<>last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and max(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: Interface {#IFNAME}: High error rate
trigger_prototype.event_name: Linux: Interface {#IFNAME}: High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: It recovers when it is below 80% of the `{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}` threshold.

dependency.name: Linux: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])=2 and (last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"],#1)<>last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"])<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

item.host: PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk average queue size (avgqu-sz)
item_prototype.description: The current average disk queue; the number of requests outstanding on the disk while the performance data is being collected.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request avg waiting time (r_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two Boolean expressions that evaluate to 1 or 0 in order to set the calculated metric to zero and to avoid the exception - division by zero.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: r/s (read operations per second) - the number (after merges) of read requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read time (rate)
item_prototype.description: The rate of total read time counter; used in `r_await` calculation.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk utilization
item_prototype.description: The percentage of elapsed time during which the selected disk drive was busy while servicing read or write requests.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write request avg waiting time (w_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two Boolean expressions that evaluate to 1 or 0 in order to set the calculated metric to zero and to avoid the exception - division by zero.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: w/s (write operations per second) - the number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write time (rate)
item_prototype.description: The rate of total write time counter; used in `w_await` calculation.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Get stats
item_prototype.description: The contents of get `/sys/block/{#DEVNAME}/stat` to get the disk statistics.

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.dev.read.await[{#DEVNAME}],15m) > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} or min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.dev.write.await[{#DEVNAME}],15m) > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high
trigger_prototype.event_name: Linux: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m)
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger might indicate the disk `{#DEVNAME}` saturation.

item.host: PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: The discovery of mounted filesystems with different types.

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent.inode[{#FSNAME},pfree],5m)<{$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Running out of free inodes
trigger_prototype.event_name: Linux: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Disk writing may fail if index nodes are exhausted, leading to error messages like "No space left on device" or "Disk is full", despite available free space.

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent.inode[{#FSNAME},pfree],5m)<{$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Running out of free inodes
trigger_prototype.event_name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Disk writing may fail if index nodes are exhausted, leading to error messages like "No space left on device" or "Disk is full", despite available free space.

dependency.name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Running out of free inodes
dependency.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent.inode[{#FSNAME},pfree],5m)<{$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}

item_prototype.name: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Space: Available
item_prototype.description: Available storage space expressed in bytes.

item_prototype.name: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Space: Used, in %
item_prototype.description: Calculated as the percentage of currently used space compared to the maximum available space.

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent.size[{#FSNAME},pused],5m)>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Space is critically low
trigger_prototype.event_name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%, total {{?last(//vfs.fs.dependent.size[{#FSNAME},total])/1024/1024/1024}.fmtnum(1)}GB)
trigger_prototype.description: The volume's space usage exceeds the `{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%` limit. The trigger expression is based on the current used and maximum available spaces. Event name represents the total volume space, which can differ from the maximum available space, depending on the filesystem type.

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent.size[{#FSNAME},pused],5m)>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Space is low
trigger_prototype.event_name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%, total {{?last(//vfs.fs.dependent.size[{#FSNAME},total])/1024/1024/1024}.fmtnum(1)}GB)
trigger_prototype.description: The volume's space usage exceeds the `{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%` limit. The trigger expression is based on the current used and maximum available spaces. Event name represents the total volume space, which can differ from the maximum available space, depending on the filesystem type.

dependency.name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Space is critically low
dependency.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent.size[{#FSNAME},pused],5m)>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}

item_prototype.name: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Option: Read-only
item_prototype.description: The filesystem is mounted as read-only. It is available only for Zabbix agents 6.4 and higher.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent[{#FSNAME},readonly],#2)=0 and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent[{#FSNAME},readonly])=1
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vfs.fs.dependent[{#FSNAME},readonly])=0
trigger_prototype.name: Linux: FS [{#FSNAME}]: Filesystem has become read-only
trigger_prototype.description: The filesystem has become read-only, possibly due to an I/O error. Available only for Zabbix agents 6.4 and higher.

graph_prototype.name: FS [{#FSTYPE}({#FSNAME})]: Space usage graph, in % (relative to max available)

item.host: PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent

graph_prototype.name: FS [{#FSTYPE}({#FSNAME})]: Space utilization chart (relative to total)

item.host: PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent
PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent

override.name: Skip metadata collection for dynamic FS

macro.description: Timeout after which agent is considered unavailable. Works only for agents reachable from Zabbix server/proxy (passive mode).
Critical threshold of CPU utilization expressed in %.
Warning threshold of error packet rate. Can be used with interface name as context.
Used as a threshold in the interface utilization trigger.
Link status trigger will be fired only for interfaces where the context macro equals "1".
The CPU load per core is considered sustainable. If necessary, it can be tuned.
Used as a threshold in the available memory trigger.
Used as a threshold in the memory utilization trigger.
Used for network interface discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Filters out `loopbacks`, `nulls`, docker `veth` links and `docker0` bridge by default.
The warning threshold of the minimum free swap.
The upper threshold for difference of system time.
The lower threshold for difference of system time. Used in recovery expression to avoid trigger flapping.
Used for block device discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Used for block device discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
The average response time (in ms) of disk read before the trigger fires.
The average response time (in ms) of disk write before the trigger fires.
Used for filesystem discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Used for filesystem discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Used for filesystem discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Used for filesystem discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
The critical threshold of the filesystem metadata utilization.
The warning threshold of the filesystem metadata utilization.
The critical threshold of the filesystem utilization.
The warning threshold of the filesystem utilization.

trigger.expression: last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/proc.num)/last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/kernel.maxproc)*100>80
trigger.name: Linux: Getting closer to process limit
trigger.event_name: Linux: Getting closer to process limit (over 80% used)

trigger.expression: max(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.swap.size[,pfree],5m)<{$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN} and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/system.swap.size[,total])>0
trigger.name: Linux: High swap space usage
trigger.event_name: Linux: High swap space usage (less than {$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN}% free)
trigger.description: If there is no swap configured, this trigger is ignored.

dependency.name: Linux: High memory utilization
dependency.expression: min(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vm.memory.utilization,5m)>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}

dependency.name: Linux: Lack of available memory
dependency.expression: max(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vm.memory.size[available],5m)<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vm.memory.size[total])>0

trigger.expression: max(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vm.memory.size[available],5m)<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and last(/PTAF PRO Base Node Monitoring by Zabbix agent/vm.memory.size[total])>0
trigger.name: Linux: Lack of available memory
trigger.event_name: Linux: Lack of available memory (<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger.description: The system is running out of memory.

trigger.name: Linux: Load average is too high
trigger.event_name: Linux: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: The load average per CPU is too high. The system may be slow to respond.
